name: absconder
content:

someone who goes away from a place suddenly, especially in order to escape from it: A 14-year-old absconder from a children's home was found alive and well this morning. The number of open prison absconders is in decline. See
abscond
More examplesFewer examplesThe boys are persistent absconders from school.The alerts would be useful for tracking down absconders. The police do not have the time to track down immigration absconders.
